intro: Epilobium heterophyllum, commonly known as the variable willow herb, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It is a member of the Onagraceae family, which includes other species like willows and evening primroses. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows, stream banks, and disturbed sites. It produces showy pink or purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate and often have a distinctive shape, varying in size and texture depending on environmental conditions.
